meanings.definition: A timepiece or timing device with a high degree of accuracy, used especially in navigation.
meanings.sent1: The sailors relied on the chronometers to guide their ship safely through the storm.
meanings.sent2: The scientist used the chronometers to measure the exact time it took for the experiment to complete.
meanings.sent3: The chronometers on the ship were so precise that they even ticked in perfect harmony with each other.
meanings.sent4: Her heart beat like a chronometer, ticking away the seconds of her life.
meanings.sent5: The chronometers gleamed in the sunlight, their hands moving steadily as if dancing to an unseen rhythm.

meanings.definition: Instruments for measuring time intervals with great precision.
meanings.sent1: The laboratory was filled with various chronometers, each designed for a specific time measurement.
meanings.sent2: The athletes used the chronometers to track their race times down to the millisecond.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous student set all the classroom chronometers five minutes ahead as a prank.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to stand still as the chronometers ticked away in the silent room.
meanings.sent5: The chronometers hummed softly, their precision unmatched by any other timekeeping device.
